item.title: Pedestrian crossing continuously cycling, 29th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Albion Street, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.category: Lights are red for no reason

item.title: Drop kerb to small for entry to address, 29th January
item.description:
Hello there is already a job in progress. TMC - Defects - Other problem Reported in the TMC - Defects - Other category by Gloucestershire County Council at 14:32 29/01/25 Reference: JOB_42567231 This is a recurring problem caused by the drop kerb being too small for the drive entry. Any filling and reseeding of verge will just be eroded by vehicles entering the drive. A hole develops which causes damage to tyres and underside of vehicles. If the drop kerb is widened then no future issues will be caused. This saves money to the council in the long run. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: A channel has been dug across the road and poorly filled in, 29th January
item.description:
Road works have dug a channel across the road that runs down the side of GE, and they have not filled it in properly creating a large hole that is especially bad travelling north on the road from the roundabout. Issue has been there for a few days, and is at high risk of damaging car wheels/tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 29th January
item.description:
Old enquiry on 11475838 - Customer has called in and has mentioned that the tree is or looks like it is slipping and this is putting pressure on the bt pole. Can this be looked into as the customer was informed by BT that they will not take action unless we are concerned for the wire and or pole.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Very lareg pothole
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes not just one!!, 29th January
item.description:
Turn into kyderminster road. All the way along up to and including the bend there are SEVERAL deep potholes. It appears one hole is filled only for another to appear and itâ€™s random holes that are filled, not all of them. Those that are filled appear shoddy and they never last. The road into kyderminster and including the bend needs complete resurfacing, not just a hole hear and there filled.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large unavoidable pothole in centre of A40 right turn from Telstar way., 29th January
item.description:
In the centre of the road as you turn right at the lights, from Telstar Way onto the A40 to head towards Arle Court roundabout (left hand lane) - cars cannot avoid without crossing into the right hand lane. Has previously been reported but this has now damaged my car. Surrounding area is also very damaged and has been this way since the road improvements. Is completely through the top surface to the lower older surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
